column6: Worker participation, consultation, and communication on occupational health and safety
column7: The Group's consistent approach to hearing testing across global operations helps identify NIHL cases at the earliest opportunity to support the initiation of intervention to prevent more debilitating illnesses. In 2023, we identified 12 instances of NIHL. We aim to continue focusing on effective hearing protection programs by ensuring workers exposed to excessive noise have been fit tested for their hearing protectors and are included in health surveillance programs.

This process underscores Woodside's commitment to maintaining a healthy and resilient workforce, ultimately contributing to the overall success and wellbeing of the organisation.

Work-related injuries
column7: The total recordable injury rate (TRIR) of 1.86 increased to 39 recordable injuries in 2023, compared to 30 in 2022. The main injury types were lacerations, wounds, and soft tissue injuries.

column6: Work-related ill health
column7: The total recordable occupational illnesses in FY23 was 24.

column7: The average training hours per person based on gender was 48 for males and 27 for females.
